Table of Contents

Class Kem

Namespace
OpenForge.Cryptography.LibOqs.KEM
Assembly
OpenForge.Cryptography.LibOqs.KEM.dll

High-level wrapper for LibOQS Key Encapsulation Mechanism (KEM) operations. This class provides a user-friendly interface for post-quantum key exchange operations. KEM algorithms are used to securely establish shared secrets between parties.

public sealed class Kem : IDisposable

object
Kem

Constructors

Kem(string)

Initializes a new instance of the KEM class with the specified algorithm.

public Kem(string algorithmName)

Parameters

algorithmName string

The name of the KEM algorithm to use.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if algorithmName is null.

NotSupportedException

Thrown if the algorithm is not supported or enabled.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the KEM instance could not be created.

Properties

AlgorithmName

Gets the name of the KEM algorithm used by this instance.

public string AlgorithmName { get; }

Property Value

string

The algorithm identifier string.

CiphertextLength

Gets the length of ciphertext in bytes for this KEM algorithm.

public int CiphertextLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The ciphertext length in bytes.

ClaimedNistLevel

Gets the NIST security level claimed by this KEM algorithm.

public byte ClaimedNistLevel { get; }

Property Value

byte

The NIST security level (1, 2, 3, or 5).

IsIndCca

Gets a value indicating whether this KEM algorithm provides IND-CCA security. IND-CCA (Indistinguishability under Chosen Ciphertext Attack) is the standard security requirement for KEMs.

public bool IsIndCca { get; }

Property Value

bool

True if the algorithm provides IND-CCA security, false otherwise.

PublicKeyLength

Gets the length of public keys in bytes for this KEM algorithm.

public int PublicKeyLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The public key length in bytes.

SecretKeyLength

Gets the length of secret keys in bytes for this KEM algorithm.

public int SecretKeyLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The secret key length in bytes.

SharedSecretLength

Gets the length of shared secrets in bytes for this KEM algorithm.

public int SharedSecretLength { get; }

Property Value

int

The shared secret length in bytes.

Methods

Decapsulate(byte[], byte[])

Decapsulates the shared secret from the ciphertext using the recipient's secret key. This recovers the same shared secret that was generated during encapsulation.

public byte[] Decapsulate(byte[] ciphertext, byte[] secretKey)

Parameters

ciphertext byte[]

The ciphertext received from the sender.

secretKey byte[]

The recipient's secret key.

Returns

byte[]

The shared secret that matches the one from encapsulation.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

Thrown if this instance has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if ciphertext or secretKey is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if parameters have invalid lengths.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if decapsulation fails.

Dispose()

Disposes the KEM instance and releases all associated resources. After disposal, this instance cannot be used for further operations.

public void Dispose()

Encapsulate(byte[])

Encapsulates a shared secret using the recipient's public key. This creates both a ciphertext to send to the recipient and a shared secret for symmetric encryption.

public (byte[] ciphertext, byte[] sharedSecret) Encapsulate(byte[] publicKey)

Parameters

publicKey byte[]

The recipient's public key.

Returns

(byte[] publicKey, byte[] secretKey)

A tuple containing the ciphertext to send and the shared secret to use.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

Thrown if this instance has been disposed.

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if publicKey is null.

ArgumentException

Thrown if the public key has an invalid length.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if encapsulation fails.

GenerateKeyPair()

Generates a new cryptographic key pair for this KEM algorithm. The secret key should be kept private and securely stored.

public (byte[] publicKey, byte[] secretKey) GenerateKeyPair()

Returns

(byte[] publicKey, byte[] secretKey)

A tuple containing the public key and secret key as byte arrays.

Exceptions

ObjectDisposedException

Thrown if this instance has been disposed.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if key pair generation fails.

GetSupportedAlgorithms()

Gets all KEM algorithms that are currently supported and enabled in LibOQS.

public static string[] GetSupportedAlgorithms()

Returns

string[]

An array of algorithm identifier strings for supported KEM algorithms.

IsAlgorithmSupported(string)

Determines whether a specific KEM algorithm is supported and available for use.

public static bool IsAlgorithmSupported(string algorithmName)

Parameters

algorithmName string

The name of the KEM algorithm to check.

Returns

bool

True if the algorithm is supported and enabled, false otherwise.
